intro: Crepis tatewakii, commonly known as the Tatewaki's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs. Crepis tatewakii is a rare species, with limited distribution and facing threats from habitat loss and environmental changes.
